headline: Tinder Warns of Declining Revenue While It Rethinks Core App
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Tinder, Match Group Inc.’s largest dating brand, said that it plans to prioritize improving its user experience over monetization, a bet that it can eventually reverse subscriber declines if it ditches its reputation as a “hookup app.”Most Read from BloombergHong Kong's Expat Party Hub Reshaped by Chinese InfluxHow California Sees the World, and ItselfLondon’s Tube Fares Are Set to Rise by 4.6% Next YearIn the meantime, Tinder warned of declining to flat direct revenue through 202

content.title: Tinder Warns of Declining Revenue While It Rethinks Core App
content.summary: (Bloomberg) -- Tinder, Match Group Inc.’s largest dating brand, said that it plans to prioritize improving its user experience over monetization, a bet that it can eventually reverse subscriber declines if it ditches its reputation as a “hookup app.”Most Read from BloombergHong Kong's Expat Party Hub Reshaped by Chinese InfluxHow California Sees the World, and ItselfLondon’s Tube Fares Are Set to Rise by 4.6% Next YearIn the meantime, Tinder warned of declining to flat direct revenue through 202
